segment.source: Windows Update for Business enables information technology administrators to keep the Windows 10-based devices in their organization always up to date with the latest security defenses and Windows features by directly connecting these systems to Microsoft’s Windows Update service.
segment.target: Windows Update for Business enables information technology administrators to keep the Windows 10-based devices in their organization always up to date with the latest security defenses and Windows features by directly connecting these systems to Microsoft’s Windows Update service.

segment.source: Peer-to-peer delivery, which administrators can enable to make delivery of updates to branch offices and remote sites with limited bandwidth very efficient.

segment.source: Together, these Windows Update for Business features help reduce device management costs, provide controls over update deployment, offer quicker access to security updates, as well as provide access to the latest innovations from Microsoft on an ongoing basis.

segment.source: Windows Update for Business is a free service for all Windows 10 Pro, Enterprise, and Education editions, and can be used independent of, or in conjunction with, existing device management solutions such as Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) and System Center Configuration Manager.
segment.target: Windows Update for Business is a free service for all Windows 10 Pro, Enterprise, and Education editions, and can be used independent of, or in conjunction with, existing device management solutions such as Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) and System Center Configuration Manager.

segment.source: For Windows 10, version 1511, Windows Update for Business is enabled using a set of client-side configurations, allowing you to manage how and when Windows-based devices receive updates and upgrades.
segment.target: For Windows 10, version 1511, Windows Update for Business is enabled using a set of client-side configurations, allowing you to manage how and when Windows-based devices receive updates and upgrades.

segment.source: These capabilities use the Windows Update service like any other Windows 10 clients, but provides controls to help businesses validate update quality as well as time their update deployments to machines through the use of Group Policy Objects.

segment.source: Windows Update for Business also incorporates smart peer-to-peer networking for distribution of Windows updates, which will help maintain bandwidth efficiency in the absence of a WSUS solution.
segment.target: Windows Update for Business also incorporates smart peer-to-peer networking for distribution of Windows updates, which will help maintain bandwidth efficiency in the absence of a WSUS solution.

segment.source: All devices running Windows 10 Pro, Enterprise, and Education on the Current Branch for Business (CBB) are Windows Update for Business eligible.
